result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1400 Block of Donald Dr in Sun Prairie WI
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

2:47 PM Defendant Michael J Condron in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Michael J Condron.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
RE: Motion to Modify Bail
Attorney Breun requests signature bond for reasons stated on the record. State does not object. Court converts bond to a signature bond and adds the following conditions:
Dane County Pretrial Services for gps monitoring
Defendant shall not be in the 1400 Block of Donald Dr in Sun Prairie WI
No contact, direct or indirect, with ASC or JGC.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

2:47 PM Defendant Michael J Condron in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Michael J Condron.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
RE: Competency Report of Dr. Ana Garcia.
Court confirms parties have received and reviewed report. Defendant agrees with report and believes he is competent. State Stipulates to findings. Court now finds defendant competent.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:15 AM Defendant Michael J Condron in court.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Ana Trespasso and Dr. Kevin Murtaugh appeared via telephone. 

Court colloquy with Defendant regarding reports filed.

State calls Dr. Ana Trespasso, duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by the State. Document #16 entered into evidence as Exhibit #1, received. No cross exam by the Defendant. 
State calls Dr. Kevin Murtaugh, duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by the State. Document #18 entered into evident as Exhibit #2, received. Cross exam by the Defendant. 

State Motions Court to Order Involuntary Treatment. Defendant makes statement. Court finds the Defendant not competent and Orders Involuntary Treatment of Defendant for reasons stated on the record.

01:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victims. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
